intro: Boerhavia diffusa var. mutabilis, commonly known as spreading hogweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that features slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it often grows in moist, disturbed soils. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively, making it a common weed in agricultural areas. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
